forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. West southwest wind around 9 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Rain Showers then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain showers between 10pm and 4am, then a chance of rain. Partly cloudy, with a low around 48. South wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
This afternoon, Downtown San Francisco basks in the gentle embrace of sunshine, a pleasant reprieve as the high hovers around fifty-eight degrees, gradually falling to the low fiftys as the day dims. The sky offers an impressive clarity, allowing the iconic outlines of the Golden Gate Bridge and the city’s skyline to be drawn against the backdrop of a bright blue expanse. There is a lightness to the air, punctuated by a west-southwest breeze that sways at about nine miles per hour, carrying the crispness of the approaching evening.

As night settles in, the ambiance shifts slightly, with whispers of a slight chance of rain brushing through the city between ten and four. The clouds that dance overhead may hint at this possibility, with a thirty percent chance of showers gracing the cooler evening, the temperature dipping to a cozy forty-eight. A light south wind prepares to rustle through the streets, suggesting a layering of light fabrics might be wise. Given this transitional day, a leisurely stroll along a waterfront path or perhaps a visit to a quaint café may offer a delightful pause. Whether one chooses to warm up indoors or embrace the crisp evening air, it is a day to appreciate the unique character that San Francisco offers, under the watchful gaze of city lights gradually twinkling into view.
